diff --git a/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc b/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc
index cf1cc9f8..351d3546 100644
--- a/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/cat/indices.asciidoc
@@ -50,6 +50,18 @@ indexing and search. As a result, all document counts include hidden
 To get an accurate count of {es} documents, use the <<cat-count,cat count>> or
 <<search-count,count>> APIs.
 
+[[cat-indices-source-only]]
+===== Indices restored from source-only snapshots
+
+Indices that have been restored from
+<<snapshots-source-only-repository,source-only snapshots>> are included in
+the cat indices API response. These indices are read-only and contain only
+stored fields and metadata, without index structures or doc values. The
+document counts (`docs.count` and `docs.deleted`) reported for source-only
+indices reflect the counts from the Lucene segments and include nested
+documents, just like regular indices. However, these indices only support
+`match_all` queries and scroll searches for reindexing purposes.
+
 
 [[cat-indices-api-path-params]]
 ==== {api-path-parms-title}
